page.title: 15HAILES WOOD 1 PAST HISTORY
page.content: INTRODUCTION Hailes wood is a{County Key Site }and is of great interest for its diverse flora,fauna and history. HISTORIC FACTORS The present composition of the woodland is the result of a combination of natural and human factors acting over several thousand years.It contains remnants of the ancient forest which formerly clothed the county.A fine stand of coppiced { {small leaved lime}(an ancient woodland indicator) covers the site of an iron age camp.Lime leaves were used as fodder,the bark for making ropes & crude cloth and the wood for fuel & building.The steep slopes & waterlogged soils of lias clay probably saved the wood from clearance by Iron age man & the Romans.
